name: places/ChIJp8PhcgtZwokRGepyiAwAOqQ
formattedAddress: 420 E 20th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 420 E 20th St, New York, NY 10009, USA

originalText.text:
I've been garage 1 customer for 10 years.
But today's happening was so disappointing
I don't know her name. When I entered garage, she all of a sudden stop my car and took a photo.  So I asked what is the purpose for that and she acting like a boss and her behavior was so aggressive, arrogant and rude. There was no respect.

For 10 years every morning, I park myself at empty space wherever.  I have no problem for 10 years.
Today she complained to me I have to stop my car in front of sign which I understand even though I haven't done for 10 years. If it is rule, fine. I get it.

But she didn't listen to me and didn't give me a chance to explain what I used to do and why. My voice was loud because she didn't listen to me and didn't give me a chance, besides her voice was more loud. She said if I voice down she will listen to me . But even though I did, she just said what she wanted to say and just ignore me and left.

She is so unprofessional and she is extremely rude. She is not right person to take care of customers.  Other co workers couldn't do anything.  just watching whatever she did to customer.  I can imagine what kind of boss she is for even co workers.

Please train her to be professional and humble.

She is not garage customer's boss. Even my boss didn't do like her.

She is horrible manager I've ever met for whole my life. It was literally terrible experience.
-------------------

Next day I've got email from her, there was not any apology and just keep making excuses.

originalText.text: Saw online it was $21, so I parked here. Ended up having to pay $57 because I didnt buy online before entering the garage.

text.text: Saw online it was $21, so I parked here. Ended up having to pay $57 because I didnt buy online before entering the garage.

originalText.text:
Unfortunately had the experience of parking here monthly for a bit. What a nightmare. There's multiple valets who drive your car as if it's the INDY 500. The carelessness is insane. If you don't care about wear and tear on your vehicle, no worries. Not to mention, picked up 3 new large dents on my doors due to lack of space (managements fault, not the garage), surprise though! The garage isn't liable! It was obviously my fault for trusting them, silly me.

Valets constantly are new because they can't retain their employees (bad management). They overbook monthly and daily spots so if you're lucky enough to actually get a parking spot (not exaggerating) it will end up getting completely blocked in (greedy management).

Not to mention if you're 4 days late due to cancelling a lost credit card that bounces payments- they won't even give you the decency of a phone call. Just one email, then they'll BOOT YOUR CAR. To the extremely overweight rude woman in the management office, hope all is well and you're enjoying your time in your windowless office daily. Oh wait, that's right you and your "management" staff work 3 hours a day.

Goodluck to whomever decides to park at this god forsaken place. You'll be lucky if you get your car back, as per the other reviewer. New valets means misplacing keys, too. Would give zero stars if I Could.

originalText.text: Rude, unprofessional staff. I arrived asking to pick up my car not exactly sure what I needed to do and the guy is all like “You want your car I need a ticket, I can’t do nothing if I don’t have a ticket.” Okay? I had a ticket, just ask me for it. Then I give him the ticket, pay, and he can’t find my keys. He starts cussing and complaining and telling me it’s not his fault. I don’t care whose fault it is, I want you to assure me that my car is okay not how inconvenient this is for you. I end up going home, get a call an hour later and they’ve found my keys. Terrible experience, makes me never want to give my car to valet service again. 0 stars if I could.
